isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION

note.para: This manual should be used to supplement the Allison troubleshooting manual TS3192EN.

caution.para: Before welding on any vehicle with an electronic control module for the transmission, engine, antilock brake system or other electronically controlled components, it is mandatory to remove all connectors going to the Electronic Control Module(s), including grounds. It is also mandatory to disconnect the positive (+) and negative (- ) battery cables before connecting the welder. Always attach welder ground cables as close as possible to the part being welded. Never connect the welder ground cable to an ECM or ECM mounting bracket.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The contents of this service manual section focus on International-installed components and wiring and how those components function as part of the transmission electronic control system. For more detailed information regarding the Allison 2000 Series transmission and the Allison supplied components that are part of the electronic control system, refer to the appropriate Allison service manuals.
The Allison 2000 Series transmission is an electronically controlled transmission designed by Allison Transmission Division of General Motors Corporation.

note.para: The majority of the troubleshooting procedures in this manual require using the EZ-Tech™ service tool with the TransPro® diagnostic software, connected to the (9-pin) diagnostic connector. TransPro software is available through Kent-Moore Heavy-Duty Division. A facility that does not have the TransPro software will be limited to checking for system power to the TCM, malfunctioning relays and poor connections.

svcproc.title: Transmission Control Module (TCM)
svcproc.para: The Transmission Control Module (TCM) is a microprocessor, which is the brain of the transmission control system ( Figure 1). The TCM contains Electronically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), which is programmed by Allison with a shift calibration that reflects the specific transmission.

figure.caption: Transmission Control Module (TCM) Functions And Controls

svcproc.para: The TCM communicates with the vehicle electrical system and International-installed transmission control components through the transmission harness.
